ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: William was articulate and clear in his instruction.

This course was adequately taught, but too brief and superficial to be a useful overview of a complex topic. I strongly feel that the 1 credit professional skills courses are a poor system for learning, even when taught by a capable professor like William. Because of this, the course is ultimately a waste of time.

In regards to pace, there was a lot of material covered in four weeks. I think it would be helpful to offer this as a half semester (ten week) course, rather than trying to cram all of the tools and topics into four weeks.

Q 9: Professor Vance is extremely open and responsive to student questions and comments. He was very happy to pause his lectures to discuss any ideas or questions that came up, and encouraged student participation.

These are general comments pertaining to the question sets as a whole. Speaking directly to students considering the course: if you need or want to enhance your communication skills as a professional in science and the environment, take the class. The exercises are on point and truly helpful. The one on one and peer coaching are very valuable. Exercises include presentation of topics, participation on a debate panel, development of one's "elevator speech" about one's career goals and more! William Vance is a warm, clear, engaging, professional and responsive communicator and coach. He models what he preaches, and he knows how to coach others to improve their skill. Those he has chosen to work with him as break-out group coaches are well qualified also and work as a team to be sure all students have an equivalent and valuable experience.

This class was extremely helpful, I wish I could take it again! The course could be even more effective if it was longer. There was often not enough class time to go over all of the material or analyze/discuss in-depth.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Honing useful skills for public speaking, writing, and presenting.
Small group breakout groups that are continued throughout the course, with the same people (for the most part), but different coaches. Great component of class!
Public speaking practice was very helpful.
The power point presentations we did and videoing of ourselves
The first two weeks of presentation practice, recorded with feedback, were particularly helpful.
The audio and video evaluation of the speaking techniques provided the opportunity for useful and actionable feedback that will make you a more compelling speaker.
This course is easy to learn, taught very well, applicable in all fields and would be useful lifelong.
Getting to practice giving and listening to speeches. Nothing's more helpful than getting to practice and receiving immediate feedback.

Splitting the class in smaller groups was a great idea that allowed for more interaction and exchange of ideas and suggestions. Recording our presentations was also a great way to really grasp how other people perceive us as we present. It led to a personal assessment of our presentation techniques.
the coaching part of the course was the best aspect

This is one of the most applicable courses at FES. It gives you simple tips and tools to use in your communication, and I have already implemented a lot of them in academic and professional settings. I really enjoyed working in small groups with my peers, it was nerve-racking to present to my friends/peers during the consecutive weeks but it also bonded us closer and we all gave each other great feedback and support. Being recorded and critiqued increased my awareness of what I needed to work on and I really think it made me improve or at least be more cognizant of how I present myself in different communication settings.
The course was very trim and on-target, getting quickly to the week's goals.
How concrete it was.
The parts I enjoyed the most were the practice of different communication techniques
Practicing presenting in front of your peers and hearing their feedback.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: This class could easily span an entire semester. I wish we had more time to develop some of the skills we began working on in class.
None!
Found the panel and networking sections to be less useful.

Perhaps give us the assignments to do right before class rather than take home to prepare because we always had to tweak them before our delivery and this often times felt rushed and diminished the value of the lesson being taught.

The sections on participating in negotiations, participating on panels, and leading a meeting weren't very helpful because the topics were given upon arrival in class. It would have been valuable to have the topics in advance to adequately prepare. It didn't simulate a real-world environment, and was therefore not very useful to practice participating with no knowledge of the topic.

The coaches provided general encouragement and basic critique, but I felt that in all of my groups the feedback could have been more intense. People should be able to received constructive criticism and need to be sure that they are getting the whole truth about their strengths and weaknesses.

The course was organized extremely well. Taking the structure as given, I can't think of any improvements. If the course structure itself can be changed, I might suggest focusing on fewer topics because the course is so short. For example, dropping the module on how to run a meeting would allow for more depth in the module on public speaking. But this is based on my personal interests, and might not reflect what students in the class would want overall.
The course could be stretched to a full-semester course. It was too short.
It would be great if the course had more than 1 credit.
Would have liked more time spent on negotiation
Honestly, I am hard-pressed to think of anything! Here is one thought: it would be good to provide a modestly larger amount of reference material for post-course use.
It would be better to promote more natural ways of communication. At times I felt that applying what was taught could lead to communicating in ways that seemed overly prepared and stiff.
It's too short

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes. Instructions provided in lecture were directly applicable and useful to subsequent practice activities.
It was very relevant and related. No improvement needed.
Yes
Yes, very effective.
The breakout sessions were very helpful - perhaps the most helpful element of the course. As I said above, I think getting (or being forced) to practice what we learned was very valuable.
I liked the way it was handled.

The discussion session was very effective. However, not all course materials had a discussion or coaching time (E.g writing session). I understand this was due to the limited time of the course had. It would be great if coaching time for writing session is provided.
The lectures and the practice sessions have a hand-in-glove fit. Well done.
It was effective.
It was good!

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The materials in this course are useful for any field, but having an opportunity to practice speaking and presenting in a scientific/environmental context was particularly beneficial. This course can be used to augment many FES classes.
I will be a more effective, clear communicator because of this course. I struggle with brevity, and this really helped me.

Will help with my negotiating skills, panel delivery and speech/ presentation delivery. I have already implemented many of the lessons learned during these past months bot professionally and as a student. THANKS !

Everyone at FES "gets" the environmental challenges we face, but preaching to the choir won't make things better. This course will help you relay ideas to a lay audience, make you more confident in being an advocate for your self, and will be a useful life-long tool that will enhance and showcase the other skills you have learned at FES.
These skills are applicable to any program, really.
This course is fit into my program, especially on improving my speech, presentation, interview skills

Communication is a key skill in any field but within the environmental field we are constantly pulling together different disciplines and needing to educate or convince an audience of why a problem matters. I found this course to be extremely relevant for other projects I will, for which presentations are usually required. Also in my seminars when I express a thought, it's like a mini-presentation and so knowing I do things like uptalking or speak to quickly has helped me improve in classroom discussions.

This course was exactly what I needed to take the next steps in communicating well as a science and environment professional. We worked on demeanor, confidence, staying on message, respecting one's audience, providing interesting information, listening and much more.
Communication can fit in any program but for me personally I am going to use public speaking techniques that I learned in this class to moderate and conduct meetings

I believe that this course if valuable to any FES student. Public speaking is something I struggle with and I believe this course gives valuable tips and provides opportunities to practice presenting in front of an audience.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to improve my communications skills and learn about best practices and habits to avoid.

I heard only great reviews about this course, and it was better than expected. I am very happy about it. It was tough because of the time of day and length of the class, but it was totally worth it. The small groups broke up the monotony of a lecture-type class, and I was always energized after it, which is not typical for an nearly 3-hr evening class on Mondays.
To become more comfortable with public speaking and presentations.
To improve the skills mentioned above

Frankly, I needed the extra credit due to poor synchronization between FES and SOM's credit systems. That FES offers a curriculum where students can find themselves in such a situation does not reflect well on the school.
I took this course because I wanted to improve my oral communication skills.
I am not a native english speaker. I wanted to improve my speaking, built my confidence to face the audience, or anybody and wanted to learn to communicate effective. my field of work required that.
To improve my skills
Learning how to be a more effective public speaker, meeting organizer, negotiator, etc. will be useful no matter what field of work I go into.
To improve my presentation and speaking abilities.
To improve my communication skill, which is really usefull for my study process and future career
I came into FES with improvement of communication skills as one of my goals.
I believe good communication skills are essential for any endeavour.
I took this course because I wanted to improve my public speaking and communication skills.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, the course met and exceeded my expectations.
They went over and beyond what I expected.
Yes, although seemed too short.
yes

I was expecting all four weeks to focus solely on oral presentation (speeches, presentations). While the negotiating or panel sessions could have been helpful, so little time was allocated to them that I didn't find them that useful. I felt like too much information was crammed into four weeks of the course, and it would be helpful to focus on a few specific skills over the four weeks rather than all types of communication.
Yes
yes
Mostly, yes.
Yes, I learned good basic skills relating to public speaking, negotiating, etc. I knew we wouldn't have time to get too in-depth, but I got good basic skills from this short PSC course.
Yes, it was a great course.
Yes
Yes, I did not realized how much this course would help me so quickly. With each week I feel like I gained an immense amount of knowledge and personal feedback to apply immediately.
Yes.
Generally.
Yes, but because the course is very short, I am going to take a bigger communication course next year and what I learned in this one will help me to hit the ground running.
Yes, I was very satisfied.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The best part of the course was group work. We practiced negotiations, being on panels and public speaking. I would highly recommend this course because of the group work.
Getting feedback from peers.
It was an essential part of the course and it was extremely helpful. I loved this part!
YEs
Part of the fear of public speaking comes from presenting to new audiences. I think it could be helpful to mix up the groups each week, rather than keeping the same groups the whole time.
Advantages Best way to put into practice and know our mistakes Know people Learn from peers Built confidence
more attention

The breakout group work was a key part of this class and was very useful. I think it would have been better to mix up the small groups more however, as the more people you observe in these activities the more awareness you have of people's different tendencies.
N/A
The break out session in every class meeting was very usefull. Feedbacks from colleagues during the break out or group session was really good for our communication improvement

Our team gave a lot of constructive feedback to each other and I encourage the teams to remain the same as much as possible with each week because a bond forms and it's important to feel safe in that setting when we are repeatedly presenting and communicating with each other.

Work groups changed a little from week to week, so there was no development of a group, but this was fine: we had opportunity to interact with a broad group of peers, communicating with many individuals and several different groups.
Group work was excellent, and very appropriate given the course's goals and content.
I was able to practice meeting discussion

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take this course if you care about communicating professionally.
Definitely take this! It's a few nights of directed work, but it is awesome
Enjoy the experience :D
You would be better served taking a full semester class in a related topic.

Everyone needs to practice their communication skills. This course MAKES you do it with your peers who also recognize the need to work and practice. If you plan on communicating an idea, sharing a thought, listening to others in the workplace, then this course will be helpful in making you better at doing all of those things.
All the students particularly international students must take this course
maybe better for 2nd year students! but Julie and William are excellent.
This course isn't going to transform you, but it provides useful and important basic skills that should be applicable to any career field. Professor Vance is a good teacher. It's worth taking!
Take it! It will be extremely valuable even for non-academic related situations.
Take it!

This should be a REQUIRED course to graduate!! It's only 4 classes and one of the best I have taken at FES so far. William and the team of coaches do a great job of working with students and answering all our questions. More importantly, no matter the level you are at with public speaking or negotiating or moderating a panel, there is SO MUCH to learn and it is immediately applicable to FES coursework and other professional settings. TAKE IT!!!!

If there are any aspects of communication you wish to develop, improve or enhance, especially as a professional in science and the environment, take the course. You will get out what you put in, and a modest investment will produce real and positive results.
Take it, it may be too short but you won't regret taking it!
